Articles.Content:
as my first time on the forum, a challenge!

it is this: create the biggest rover you can and blast it to any planetary body or moon via rocket

my attempt:

the launch vehicle was rather.... big.

this is intended for fun and no "winner" shall be announced though i will applaud they who build a larger craft.

this is intended to be all stock and no cheating, no other rules apply.

Edited February 23, 2014 by Nothing But Rubus
Watch out, you shall summon The Whackjob with this kind of challenges!

Ah, i've been looking for this a challenge of this kind for long!

Unfortanley it may crash my computer, but if i turn on graphics to lowest it may work.

Okay, so i made a rocket for this challenge!

Test #1

Failure : Rocket fell over and exploded on launchpad

Test #2

Failure : Structural failure, one fuel pipe got destroyed and i lost control of boosters

Test #3

Failure : Structural failure, all boosters detached at 8800 meters.

Test #4

Failure Structural failure, seperators did not seperate at injection burn, it flew into kerbins atmosphere at over 3100m/s
I don't wish to be rude, but I think your resolution is set wrong..

I don't wish to be rude, but I think your resolution is set wrong..

I set my reentry effects at minimum so my computer don't crash, even if i just make a one part ship and put on the very low setting it will crash almost instant at reentry. :/

FINALLY LANDED THAT ROVER ON THE MUN!! (KINDA)

Total mass : 12.67T

Easy did this some time ago:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

~200 tons of rover powah on Eve. While it uses some mods for the bling bling lights, the crane, the big badass fuel tank (just treat it like 5 1/2 orange tanks), the rest (rover and delivery) is stock.

I set my reentry effects at minimum so my computer don't crash, even if i just make a one part ship and put on the very low setting it will crash almost instant at reentry. :/

Oh I see, my bad.
